ygData.subject: Re: Crystal Numbers II
ygData.msgSnippet: I stack Chords and Hymn and this seems to work especially well against beings who conn red or yellow (i can take most yellow on and some red) Danillo ... play
ygData.messageBody:
I stack Chords and Hymn and this seems to work especially well
against beings who conn red or yellow (i can take most yellow on and
some red)

Danillo


>From: Basil Eckert <athelas@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqbards] Re: Crystal Numbers II
>Date: Mon, 26 Apr 1999 14:12:34 +0200 (MEST)
>
>From: Basil Eckert <athelas@...>
>
>Hey!
>
>This results are quite interesting. I am a level 15 bard and used to
play
>Jonthan's Warsong and Brusco's Bellow when soloing and Anthem de
Arms /
>Brusco's Bellow when fighting in team.
>But now i'm not sure if this is still the best combination, cause my
>bellow does 8 dmg and I can start it just 2 times until i have to
restart the
>buff song. Maybe it would have more effect to switch between Chords
of
>Dissonance and the buff song cause the damage made by Chords until I
have to switch
>back to the buff song would be higher than 16 points.
>What do other bards think about that? What song combinations do you
use
>when fighting solo or in party?
>
>Athelas
>Tarew Marr
>
